nodes.label: Psychiatry consult for mental health support

edges.label: experiencing
edges.detailed_description: The patient is experiencing abdominal fullness and discomfort.
edges.facts_and_info: Patient presented with chief complaint of abdominal fullness and discomfort.

edges.label: complication
edges.detailed_description: Ascites is a complication leading to Hepatic Encephalopathy (HE).
edges.facts_and_info: Ascites contributes to the development of HE in the patient.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with ascites.
edges.facts_and_info: Patient has significant abdominal distention and visible veins due to ascites.

edges.label: related condition
edges.detailed_description: Hepatic Encephalopathy (HE) is related to hyponatremia.
edges.facts_and_info: Hyponatremia is a common complication in patients with HE.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with Hepatic Encephalopathy (HE).
edges.facts_and_info: Patient is being managed with lactulose and rifaximin for HE.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with hyponatremia.
edges.facts_and_info: Hyponatremia is evident from the low sodium level of 125 mmol/L.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with coagulopathy.
edges.facts_and_info: Coagulopathy is indicated by an INR of 1.4.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has HIV on HAART.
edges.facts_and_info: Patient's HIV status and antiretroviral therapy are part of their medical history.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has COPD.
edges.facts_and_info: COPD is a chronic condition the patient manages.

edges.label: diagnosed with
edges.detailed_description: The patient has bipolar affective disorder and PTSD.
edges.facts_and_info: Mental health conditions are part of the patient's history.

edges.label: risk factor
edges.detailed_description: Ascites increases the risk of Spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP).
edges.facts_and_info: Patient is at higher risk for SBP due to ascites.

edges.label: related condition
edges.detailed_description: Ascites is related to Hepatorenal syndrome.
edges.facts_and_info: Hepatorenal syndrome is a potential complication of decompensated cirrhosis with ascites.

edges.label: related condition
edges.detailed_description: Ascites is related to Portal vein thrombosis.
edges.facts_and_info: Portal vein thrombosis can occur in patients with ascites and cirrhosis.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Albuterol Inhaler.
edges.facts_and_info: Used for COPD management.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Truvada.
edges.facts_and_info: Part of HIV treatment regimen.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Furosemide.
edges.facts_and_info: Diuretic used to manage ascites and edema.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Raltegravir.
edges.facts_and_info: HIV antiretroviral therapy.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Spironolactone.
edges.facts_and_info: Diuretic for ascites management, but discontinued due to elevated potassium.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Acetaminophen.
edges.facts_and_info: Used for pain management.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Tiotropium Bromide.
edges.facts_and_info: COPD maintenance medication.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Rifaximin.
edges.facts_and_info: Used to manage Hepatic Encephalopathy (HE).

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Calcium Carbonate.
edges.facts_and_info: Supplement for bone health.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Lactulose.
edges.facts_and_info: Primary treatment for HE.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on Sulfameth/Trimethoprim DS.
edges.facts_and_info: Used for prophylaxis, likely related to HIV management.

edges.label: allergic to
edges.detailed_description: The patient is allergic to Percocet.
edges.facts_and_info: Allergy noted in medical history.

edges.label: diagnostic test
edges.detailed_description: Diagnostic paracentesis was performed for ascites.
edges.facts_and_info: 4.3L of fluid removed during therapeutic paracentesis.

edges.label: diagnostic imaging
edges.detailed_description: Abdominal ultrasound showed moderate ascites and patent portal vein.
edges.facts_and_info: Imaging confirmed the presence of ascites and ruled out portal vein thrombosis.

edges.label: underwent procedure
edges.detailed_description: The patient underwent therapeutic paracentesis.
edges.facts_and_info: 4.3L of ascitic fluid removed for relief.

edges.label: received treatment
edges.detailed_description: Patient received albumin replacement.
edges.facts_and_info: Albumin administered to manage hypoalbuminemia associated with cirrhosis.

edges.label: on medication
edges.detailed_description: The patient is on diuretics (spironolactone, furosemide).
edges.facts_and_info: Diuretics adjusted; spironolactone discontinued due to elevated potassium.

edges.label: consultation
edges.detailed_description: Hepatology consult for TIPS evaluation.
edges.facts_and_info: Consult initiated to assess suitability for Transjugular Intrahepatic Portosystemic Shunt (TIPS).

edges.label: consultation
edges.detailed_description: Nutrition consult ordered.
edges.facts_and_info: Focus on dietary management of cirrhosis and HE.

edges.label: consultation
edges.detailed_description: Psychiatry consult for mental health support related to HE.
edges.facts_and_info: Consult aimed at addressing mental health issues complicating HE treatment.
